channel.title: Hunter Retribution
channel.description:
The king told the council that #7 was unseen. So we all voted for him. I did first.
At that time I then noticed the assassin had DIED that night (He was #8) and told the council that there was NO way the king had found unseen since MM shows up as inno for 3 days. I pardoned. The rest of the council guiltied. Turns out #7 was hunter. He used his retribution ability. Since I was the first to accuse him, I was killed even though I was the ONLY one who pardoned him.
#### What was SUPPOSED to happen? I dont know, but its not ok that I died when I was the one to pardon him.

item.title: Hunter Retribution
item.dc:creator: Loudo
item.description:
Personally I like the ability as it works right now.

I don’t want this to become like the Jester’s hunt is in Town of Salem, where evils can push someone on the stand and then not vote guilty at the last second.
If you are the first one to accuse someone you are probably the one who pushed them up the stand. Simply voting pardon or abstaining shouldn’t be enough to avoid the retribution IMHO. You need to convince everyone else to vote pardon as well.

Read full topic
